snippet: The United States said Wednesday that Iraq had an obligation to stop and inspect Iranian planes flying through its airspace that are suspected of carrying arms to Syria.
abstract: State Department says that Iraq has an obligation under United Nations Security Council resolutions to insist that Iranian planes that are suspected of flying arms to Syria over Iraqi airspace land so the cargo can be inspected; Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki tells a group of visiting American senators that he has been assured by the Iranians that the flights carried only humanitarian aid and that the United States had yet to provide proof that military equipment and weapons were being shipped.

byline.contributor: Omar al-Jawoshy contributed reporting from Baghdad.

lead_paragraph: The United States said Wednesday that Iraq had an obligation to stop and inspect Iranian planes flying through its airspace that are suspected of carrying arms to Syria.

headline.seo: U.S. Presses Iraq on Iran Flights Thought to Carry Arms
headline.main: U.S. Presses Iraq on Iranian Planes Thought to Carry Arms to Syria
headline.print_headline: U.S. Presses Iraq on Iran Flights Thought to Carry Arms to Syria
